triggers.description: A controllable but inescapable threat is likely to elicit reactive aggression and anger
Anticipate reward can not be achieved owing to non-self factors will lead to anger
A food-rejection response centered on avoiding the intake of offensive stimuli
Animal-reminder disgust is a reminder of our own mortality and inherent animalistic nature, about sex, injury to the body or violations of its outer envelope, and death
related to the avoidance of disease probability through pathways other than ingestion
